snippet.title: Smooth 2D Fluid Dynamics | GPU Shaders [GLSL] - Game Ready
snippet.description:
Vitality - Coming 2020: https://store.steampowered.com/app/805890/Vitality/

First bit of progress towards getting the new water system for Vitality working :)! Still missing a fair few features and has issues in places, but on the whole, i'm pretty happy with it :D!
For those interested, it's based on the Navier-Stokes equations and runs entirely on the GPU :) ... More information below ...

The current version runs at 2000 fps for a simulation space of 160*90 cells on a GTx970. Though this is unoptimised and has a few other bits and pieces thrown in.

Features I will be adding:
- Pressure equilibrium (Atm the velocity field is approximated by comparing the flow of nearby cells, a pressure system would be more ideal, and would allow for more complex behaviour)

- Multi-fluid support. Not sure how feasible this will be, but i'd like to support multiple fluid types. This will probably be a flag for a cell which affects viscousity. and a cell "could" simultaneously contain multiple volumes of liquid, just of different types. 
The main liquid that I want to support is oil that will float on top of water.

- Force dynamics (using pressure + velocity field). Be able to apply force to parts of the water to create ripples. This may not work however, as the water is in-compressible atm.
